author: hwright
msg: JavaHL: Abstract the creating of RevisionRange arrays, and at the same time,
revise a method on the MergeInfo object to accept a simple array, instead
of a List.
[ in subversion/bindings/javahl/ ]
* native/SVNClient.h,
native/SVNClient.cpp
(makeJRevisionRangeArray): New helper function.
(getMergeInfo, getAvailableMerges): Use new function.
* src/org/tigris/subversion/javahl/MergeInfo.java
(addRevisions): Instead of a list of RevisionRanges, just use an array.

author: dlr
msg: * www/svn_1.5_releasenotes.html
(wc-and-repos-format-change): Remove XXX note.  Tweak formatting.
(cancellation-improvements): Add brief description.

author: glasser
msg: While Subversion's branches are lightweight, there's some social
overhead involved in making a new branch in /branches in our
repository.  It's not something you want to do for quickly
checkpointing half-written code: after all, every commit sends out
mail, and you don't want to waste other developer's time reviewing
patches you know are unfinished.
On the other hand, if the commit messages were turned off (or
redirected to a different mailing list that only the most paranoid
developers were on), the repository would be a great place for
committers to checkpoint big patches.  So let's just make a separate
directory for "below the radar" branches: /checkpoints.
(This idea seemed good to some of us on IRC.)
Note that you shouldn't actually use this until somebody changes the
mailer hooks.

author: hwright
msg: Followup to r27133 to get the JavaHL bindings compiling again.
* subversion/bindings/javahl/native/SVNClient.cpp
(merge): Create and pass the required array of svn_opt_revision_range_t's
to svn_client_merge_peg3().

author: glasser
msg: The march towards backward-compatibility testing: don't expect a test
to pass unless the server is sending copyfrom on updates.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/svntest/main.py
(server_sends_copyfrom_on_update): New function.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/update_tests.py
(test_list): Skip test #37 unless server sends copyfrom on updates.
